Through the Yext platform, you can choose to send a [single invite](https://help.yext.com/hc/en\-us/articles/115005731523) to generate a first party review from a specific customer, [multiple invites](https://help.yext.com/hc/en\-us/articles/115005986686) to generate them from a larger audience, or use an SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) Server Connection. This article explains how to add and manage an SFTP Server Connection to generate reviews.  
Note: You must have a Full Account scope, and the Send Invites, Configure Templates, and Manage SFTP Connections permissions in order to view, create, and configure SFTP Server Connections for Review Generation.





To add a new SFTP Server Connection:





1. Click **Reviews** in the navigation bar and click **Generation**.
2. Click **Send Invites**.
3. Click on the **Add New Connection** button under **SFTP Server Connection**.
4. Enter a name for your connection in the text box.
5. Select your desired schedule.



   * Note: If you select **None**, your SFTP Server Connection will need to be run manually, which is explained in the next section of this article.




6. Enter the host address of your server without the protocol (sftp://) in the text box.
7. Enter the port to connect to in the text box. The default port for SFTP is 22.
8. Select your desired authentication method.



   * Username \& Password



     1. Select **Username \& Password** from the drop\-down menu.
     2. Enter your Username in the text box.
     3. Enter your Password in the text box.




   * SSH Private Key




     1. Select **SSH Private Key** from the drop\-down menu.
     2. Enter your Username in the text box.
     3. Enter your SSH Private Key in the text box.




9. Select your desired lookup strategy and fill out the fields accordingly.



   * For more information about these file settings, see the [SFTP Server Connection for Review Generation](https://hitchhikers.yext.com/docs/reviews/sftp\-server\-connection\-for\-review\-generation/) reference documentation.




10. Click **Save**.





To manage an SFTP Server Connection:





1. Click **Reviews** in the navigation bar and click **Generation**.
2. Click **Send Invites**.
3. Click on the drop\-down button next to **Add New Connection** button under **SFTP Server Connection** and click **Manage Connections**.
4. The steps to manage your existing SFTP Server Connections differ depending on what you would like to do. Follow the steps below accordingly:




   * View Connection Configuration \& Connection Logs



     1. Click on the **View** button next to the desired connection.




        * View Logs




          1. Click on the **Logs** tab.
          2. (Optional) Click **Download Details** for more information.




   * Edit a Connection Configuration



     1. Click on the **View** button next to the desired connection.
     2. Click on the field you would like to edit.
     3. Make your desired changes.
     4. Click **Save**.




   * Manually Run a Connection



     1. Click on the drop\-down button next to the desired connection and click **Run Now** in the drop\-down menu.




   * Enable or Disable a Connection



     1. Click on the drop\-down button next to the desired connection and select the option to **Enable** or **Disable** the connection in the drop\-down menu.




        * Note: If Maximum Contact Frequency is disabled, you will not be able to enable connections. You can read more about this setting in the next section.




   * Delete a Connection




     1. Click on the drop\-down button next to the desired connection and click **Delete** in the drop\-down menu. A dialog box appears.
     2. If applicable, enter the name of the connection in the text box.
     3. Click **Delete**.





## Maximum Contact Frequency

Maximum Contact Frequency is a required setting for using SFTP Server Connections for Review Generation. This prevents duplicate invites from being sent during each scheduled SFTP file pickup.





If the Maximum Contact Frequency setting is Disabled, you must enable it in order to automatically or manually run any existing SFTP Server Connections.





If the Maximum Contact Frequency setting is Enabled, you must disable or delete any existing SFTP Server Connections before you can disable it.





To update the Maximum Contact Frequency setting:





1. Click **Reviews** in the navigation bar and click **Generation**.
2. Click **Settings**.
3. Click on the **Maximum Contact Frequency** field and select your desired options.
4. Click **Save**.
